name: Casa Dona Susana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Casa Susana based on a friend's recommendation and the good reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel had a wonderful authentic feel and the staff could not have been nicer. We had a jr. suite on the third floor - it was a large room with a big balcony. (Would not want to have a room w/no balcony). The use of the pools at all three hotels is great and the beach facilities are wonderful. We found many great restaurants and watering holes. The staff gave us fantastic recommendations for several restaurants.
reviews.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel for small $$$

likes.liked: — The authentic feel. You knew you were in Mexico
likes.disliked: — A bit of a musty smell in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel based on good price and Tripadvisor and Expedia comments. The short answer is the pool wasn't working, the rooms a little old, and all the restaurants and activities are at the main hotel Playa Los Arcos. Food was good (at main hotel).
reviews.title: OK, Quaint Hotel at Very Good Prices, but Preferred Playa Los Arcos

likes.liked: — Location to activities in Los Muertos area and the beach
likes.disliked: — a but dated, pool wasn't working, no restuarant (although plenty nearby)

reviews.text: When we check in in late Sept 2008, we were given a different room, no the Junior Suite we booked. We were given a very small room, although it had a huge balcony. We were told why, but it turned out our room had flooded, also the rain prevented the elevator from working, so staff did not want to give us a Jr suite room on the higher floors (with no elevator).
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next day when we complained. The hotel offered a suite in each other 2 hotels. We chose Playa Los Arcos, since it had pool and ocean view, and was very close to the restaurant and beach. The staff was terrific, and we got a nice upgrade. In reality, we would have liked the Jr. suite at casa Dona Susana, but since pool was working and no restaurant or bar at the Casa Dona Susana , staying at the Playa Los Arcos made more sense.
reviews.title: Best Deal

likes.liked: — It didn't feel like a hotel - it felt more like a home.
likes.disliked: — Our room didn't have a view, but we didn't spend much time there so it didn't matter.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good, some dishes gourmet quality. Drinks that came as part of all-inclusive were boring and weak. The Los Muertos beach area has many restaurants and shops, so it is very easy to dine out within one or two block walk. In fact, many of the nearby restaurants are gourmet quality.
reviews.title: Great for New Years!
Nice Economical, friendly old girl to rest your sunburned head
reviews.text: Booked fully inclusive package over the internet.
Travelled economy fare, and left afternoon flight from
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Toronto. Arrived at hotel late that night...this timetable works best.
reviews.title: Hot Fun in the Sun !!

likes.liked: — Staff was very attentive... Made our stay much more relaxed!
likes.disliked: — Not being directly on the beach ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at Hotel:
reviews.title: No Frills but Great Location

likes.liked: — Nice a/c unit. Mini fridge. Cable TV.
likes.disliked: — Musty smell. Unfriendly desk clerk. No frills.

reviews.title: Great location for budget honeymooners
reviews.text: Courteous staff directed us to our room. It was at the

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend thought our room was really ghetto, since it had only the esentials, and the shower was only 2 plastic frail-looking doors. But then he saw the pool at the top of the hotel and he felt in love with it! That was one of our fave spots to hang out, since there was no other people we had the pool to ourselves with a great view of Puerto Vallarta. The receptionist and bell boy were extremely nice to us. We even ask them to hold for our suitcases for a couple of hours till we did last minute shopping and they did. The room smell musty and our AC leaked, other than that it was ok. After all we just needed a place to crash after we were done with our excursions. They mop the room every day :)
reviews.title: Excellent location, awesome pool, room was OK

likes.liked: — The location, everything was walking distance
likes.disliked: — That our room was humid and the AC kept leaking

reviews.title: Could be better
reviews.text: This hotel boasted on Travelocity that they were an adult only resort and it was very frustrating waking up or going to sleep hearing kids screaming and crying. The hotel overall was nice, the food could've been better. I ate at a small place down the street the whole time.
I was booked elsewhere and changed to this hotel solely
reviews.title: Not adults only -lots of kids

likes.disliked: — noisy due to architecture and KIDS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: for the adults only feature. NOT SO! Numerous
reviews.title: Charming Digs in the Heart of Old Vallarta

likes.disliked: — No open window in my room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: children were there, noisy and crying, etc. Front desk says
reviews.title: Good Location!

likes.disliked: — The Bed and smell of the room.

reviews.text: I recently returned from a stay at this hotel. I was drawn in by the cheap rates and the fact that I booked last minute. After I had made the reservation I read some of the reviews on Trip Advisor and had concerns about the smell in the rooms.
reviews.title: OK room but musty smell

likes.liked: — staff was friendly and close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I arrived at the hotel I was placed in room 101. The room had a very strong musty smell. I didnt even want to take my clothes out the suit case. I asked to be moved but the front desk said they didnt have another comparable room. I spent the first night in the room only to be woken up several times by the strong smell.
reviews.title: Great for what it is...

reviews.text: The next day the front desk did move me to another smaller room. I asked about the difference in my cost since I was moving from a junior suite to a standard room. I was told that because they had filled my reservation as requested and I asked to be moved that I did not get a refund of the $120.00.
reviews.title: Great Value & Location

reviews.text: The new room also smelled but not as bad as the first. When I got home the smell lingered in everything. I did not even bring the suit cases into the house because the odor was so strong. I also witnessed other guests complaining of the smell and some checking out because of it.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will say the staff for the most part were very friendly with the exception of not giving me back the difference in the cost of the room. Also since all the doors open to a center courtyard you can hear everyone closing their doors. You can also hear the slamming of the elevator when it closes. Both of these sound like a large slam that echoes through the courtyard. I had to buy ear plugs just to sleep.
reviews.title: Don't make phone calls from hotel

likes.disliked: — cheated by staff over phone call costs

aka: Casa Dona Susana Hotel Puerto Vallarta
